page.title: 17Language in Uzmaston area
page.content: The language spoken is English but there is some Welsh used, mainly in families which have moved into the area. Welsh is taught in the Nursery, Primary and Secondary Schools. Many {dialect words}are still in existence and here are some examples:- {DRANG}Narrow passage {HOBBLE}A job {BURGAGE }Small field {KIFT}Awkward {SKADDLY}Grasping{ MITCHIN}Absent {TROLLIES}Suet dumplings{ WALLOP}Strike {RAMMASING}Wandering {KEDGEN}Begging {MOILIN}Grub like a pig {CRWT}Bay {MOCHEN }Dirty pig {DISLES}Thistles {SLOP}Gap in the bank {COWELL}Basket {LABBIN}Gossiping {PEWKED}Vomiting {HAWSE} " or Questioning{DRUKE}Turn {HAGGLIN}Arguing {SHONK}Smart {MIDDLIN }Pretty good {STIVVLE}Freeze {CUTCH DOWN}Crouch {RACCASS}Noise {FULL"IS SKIN"}Too fat {BELTIN}Raining {IN THE GRIP}In the hedge
